group_1.textRight: The breeze feels nice, doesn't it?

group_1.textLeft: It does...
But it's not really making me feel any better...

group_1.textRight: Me neither...
I still can't get over that night...
Even knowing Witches used to be Magical Girls, @I don't hesitate to slay them,
but despite that, I'll never get used to fightin' @against fellow Magical Girls.

group_1.textLeft: We have to shut out our emotions...

group_1.textRight: That's what Ao's doin'.

group_1.textLeft: She's a sweet girl, so she's probably feeling @even worse than we are...
...Are the other Janomiya girls doing alright?

group_1.textRight: Yep.
Ao convinced them to trust in us.
Plus, the Janomiya girls who'd infiltrated @Torayamachi helped sway the others.
They'd spent so much time with us, after all.

group_1.textLeft: Ao still hasn't shown herself, though...

group_1.textRight: I'm sure she's up to somethin' right now.

group_1.textLeft: If you run into her somewhere,
tell her that we're waiting for her to join us.

group_1.textRight: Aye!
Now all that's left is dealin' with Ryuugasaki.

group_1.textLeft: With so many of them hurt, they've undoubtedly @lost faith in Juri,
so we should be able to convince them to side @with us instead...

group_1.textRight: I don't think it's gonna be that easy...

group_1.textLeft: If we hadn't been there, some of them would @have turned into Witches...
They owe us for the Grief Seeds we gave them.
What's next is to give them a sense of security.

group_1.textRight: A sense of security?

group_1.textLeft: By now, they should all understand that Witches @have returned to the city.
But since it's been so long, they're afraid that @the Witches will vanish again.
You may be unable to relate to that since you've @been with me this whole time.

group_1.textRight: There's no way of makin' them feel safe @other than finding more Witches, though...

group_1.textLeft: Actually, there is.
If we find out what caused the Witches to vanish @in the first place,
we can prepare for whatever happens next.

group_1.textRight: What if the cause is somethin' that's out of @our hands?

group_1.textLeft: Should that be the case, @we'll have to change our plans...

group_1.textRight: Sounds like a big gamble.

group_1.textLeft: It's preferable to not knowing the truth.

group_1.textRight: Ah, Yuna, the meeting's about to start.

group_1.textLeft: We should head back, then...

group_1.narration: "What about Juri, by the way? @We haven't heard from her since that night."
"Just leave her be. @She will probably come back to try to fight me, @even if she's the last one left in Ryuugasaki."

group_1.textRight: YUNA!

group_1.textLeft: Sakuya, what's going on?

group_1.textRight: You know that girl we sent chasing a Witch?
We might've found her!

group_1.textLeft: What did you say...?!
So, where is she...?

group_1.textRight: I don't have the details, but somebody said they saw her...!

group_1.textLeft: (Is that truly reliable information...?)
(And can I really afford to have Sakuya away while @we're still recovering...?)

select.textSelect: Have Sakuya look into the missing Magical Girl

group_2.textLeft: (But if we find her, what she knows might help us to convince Ryuugasaki to join us...)
Will you look into this for me?

group_2.textRight: Sure, that was my plan anyway.

group_3.textLeft: (This isn't a good time for this...)
I don't think it's a good idea to have you away while we're still recovering...
Let's pause the investigation for now and see how things turn out.

select.textSelect: Have Sakuya look into the missing Magical Girl
